items.content_html:
Description

This PR removes a macro which repeats a single line of text. The ratio of replaced text per macro invocation doesn't appear to be worth it considering the overhead.

Motivation

Removing less-useful macros from content.

See https://github.com/mdn/yari/blob/main/kumascript/macros/no_tag_omission.ejs
items.title: chore(macros): Replace no_tag_omission macro with single sentence of text

items.content_html:
Description

Adding parameter type

Motivation

The current description does not include the parameter type

Additional details

I can't find it in the spec, but if you want to test, run:

CSSStyleValue.parse("transform", "matrix(1, 2, -1, 1, 80, 80)")[0].matrix.constructor.name
items.title: Including matrix type

items.content_html:
Description

Chromium itself does not limit the length of the name field in extension's manifest.json. The limit is only enforced by the stores used to download the extension. This may be important to developers who are self hosting an extension, or hosting outside of the Chrome Web Store or Edge Addons store.

This updates to make this nuance more explicit.

Additionally, today the chrome web store increased this limit to 75 characters. I manually confirmed that the Edge Addon store is still enforcing a 45 character limit.

Motivation

The documentation for the maximum length of the name field in extensions is out of date, and not technically correct.

Additional details
items.title: update docs about `name` length for WebExtensions

items.content_html: This PR is a cherry-pick from #32366 that removes mention of global attributes on individual SVG elements pages.
items.title: Remove mention of global attributes on individual SVG elements pages

items.content_html:
Description

The MongoDB connection details for Railway in Express Tutorial 7 have been updated to the latest version.

Motivation

I believe this contribution will bring the Express Tutorials up-to-date with the latest versions of current technologies. This will help readers/learners avoid confusion caused by outdated information .

Additional details

https://docs.railway.app/guides/mongodb

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes Issue #32378
items.title: Update MongoDB Connection Content of Railway with the latest version.

items.content_html:
Description

Chrome 121 now supports animating smoothly between two font-palette values, and the palette-mix() function (which was implemented as part of supporting font-palette animation). See https://chromestatus.com/feature/5177171439517696. This PR adds the following:

  • An animation example on the font-palette reference page.
  • A dedicated palette-mix() reference page that includes an example.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #32308
items.title: Tech review: document font-palette animation and palette-mix()

items.content_html: According to the spec values 'src' and 'self' should be quoted for <iframe>'s allow attribute.
items.title: docs: quote src and self values for allow attr

items.content_html:
This PR performs a number of updates to the SVG attributes pages to clean up the pages:

  • Remove mention of global attributes on individual elements pages
  • Remove landing pages for attribute categories
  • Update BCD keys

Note: review and merge along with mdn/browser-compat-data#22267.

Follow-up: remove all use of the SVGAttr macro.
items.title: Clean up global SVG attributes

items.content_html:
Description

Change of phrasing for clarity

Motivation

The paragraph below the code example distinguishes the terms parameter and argument. The following paragraph is about how arguments are passed to functions. One would expect that there would be another comparison between these terms but this is not the case. In my opinion, it is more clear to say "Arguments in JavaScript are always".
items.title: Update passing arguments in functions reference

items.content_html:
Description

Chrome 121 has added several new features for the Speculation Rules API:

  • The Speculation-Rules HTTP response header, which allows developers to set speculation rules on a page via a response header, without modifying the actual page code. See https://chromestatus.com/feature/5069400512659456 for more info.
  • Document-sourced rules, which allow developers to specify a set of rules to include or exclude the URLs linked in the document in the list for prefetching/prerendering, rather than specifying an exact list of URLs. See https://chromestatus.com/feature/5112150536749056
  • The eagerness field, which allows developers to set how eagerly they want URLs to be prefetched/prerendered. See https://chromestatus.com/feature/5091678266851328.
  • The No-Vary-Search HTTP response header, which is used to indicate whether URL params should be ignored when deciding whether to fetch a page from cache or not. See https://chromestatus.com/feature/5071247189213184
  • The expects_no_vary_search field, which allows developers to report the expected value of the No-Vary-Search response header in the speculation rules, and use that to determine whether a prefetch would be beneficial or not. See https://chromestatus.com/feature/4887338302308352

This PR adds content to cover all of the above features.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Related compat data PR: mdn/browser-compat-data#22262
items.title: Tech review: Add Chrome 121 new speculation rules features

items.content_html:
Description

According to Specifications the type of stdDeviation is not number but number-optional-number.
items.title: Fixed type of stdDeviation in feDropShadow

items.content_html:
Added two lines breaks after finished so the next time the function is used it won't appear in the same line but in the next one.

Description

Updating the finished line adding two lines breaks so the next time the function is used it doesn't appear in the same line.

Motivation

Is more readable that way and so it doesn't saturate the ending line.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Updated 'calculating squares' code

items.content_html:

It also adds the same information to the release note in the new section. Note that I don't yet understand the structure expected for this section - it seems to just be a duplication of the text.

Related docs work can be tracked in #32337

items.content_html:
This follows on from #32246

Essentially it pushes the ability to use .env file to load environment variables to be part of the default deployment setup. That is much easier because you don't have a custom .wsgi file - you just create the file if you need it, or environment variables otherwise.

Sorry for the late addition.
items.title: Simplify dotenv use and deployment

items.content_html:
As far as I can see, no browser correctly implements visibility:collapse whee a collapse row participates in a row spanning cell. See https://jsfiddle.net/nauro2dt/

Motivation

This feature has been incorrectly and inconsistently implemented for many years so that it is unable to be used as designed. The hope is that by identifying this issue, browsers might someday implement it correctly so that it can be used.

Additional details

Example showing what does happen versus what should happen
Old post to the www-style mailing list giving an explanation with reasons
items.title: visibility:collapse on spanning table cells
